intro: Ardisia lankawiensis, commonly known as the Lankawi ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
